results.title: Protective effect of metformin on lithium-induced nephrogenic diabetes insipidus: An experimental study in rats.
results.text_hl: Protective effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ on @CHEMICAL_Lithium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008094 @@@lithium@@@-induced @<m>DISEASE_Diabetes_Insipidus_Nephrogenic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018500 @@@nephrogenic diabetes insipidus@@@: An experimental study in @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

results.title: An AMPK activator as a therapeutic option for congenital nephrogenic diabetes insipidus
results.text_hl: The data from our @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ study, however, inspired us to seek a potent and orally active AMPK activator as a potential therapy for @<m>DISEASE_Diabetes_Insipidus_Nephrogenic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018500 @@@NDI@@@ due to @GENE_AVPR2 @GENE_12000 @@@V2R@@@ mutations.

citations.NLM: Klein JD, Khanna I, Pillarisetti R, Hagan RA, LaRocque LM, Rodriguez EL, Sands JM. An AMPK activator as a therapeutic option for congenital nephrogenic diabetes insipidus JCI Insight. 2021 Apr 22;6(8):. PMID: 33724959
citations.BibTeX: @article{33724959, title={An AMPK activator as a therapeutic option for congenital nephrogenic diabetes insipidus}, author={Klein JD and Khanna I and Pillarisetti R and Hagan RA and LaRocque LM and Rodriguez EL and Sands JM}, journal={JCI Insight}, volume={6}, number={8}}

results.title: A mini-review of pharmacological strategies used to ameliorate polyuria associated with X-linked nephrogenic diabetes insipidus.
results.text_hl: Promising effects on @<m>DISEASE_Diabetes_Insipidus_Nephrogenic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018500 @@@NDI@@@ in preclinical studies have been demonstrated by the use of pharmacological approaches with @GENE_SCT @GENE_6343 @@@secretin@@@, @GENE_WNT5A @GENE_7474 @@@Wnt5a@@@, protein kinase A agonist, @CHEMICAL_Fluconazole @CHEMICAL_MESH:D015725 @@@fluconazole@@@, prostaglandin E2 EP2 and @GENE_PTGER4 @GENE_5734 @@@EP4@@@ agonists, statins, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, and soluble prorenin receptor agonists.

citations.NLM: Mortensen LA, Bistrup C, Jensen BL, Hinrichs GR. A mini-review of pharmacological strategies used to ameliorate polyuria associated with X-linked nephrogenic diabetes insipidus. Am J Physiol Renal Physiol. 2020 Nov 1;319(5):F746-F753. PMID: 32924547
citations.BibTeX: @article{32924547, title={A mini-review of pharmacological strategies used to ameliorate polyuria associated with X-linked nephrogenic diabetes insipidus.}, author={Mortensen LA and Bistrup C and Jensen BL and Hinrichs GR}, journal={Am J Physiol Renal Physiol}, volume={319}, number={5}, pages={F746-F753}}

results.title: Metformin improves urine concentration in rodents with nephrogenic diabetes insipidus.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ improves urine concentration in rodents with @<m>DISEASE_Diabetes_Insipidus_Nephrogenic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018500 @@@nephrogenic diabetes insipidus@@@.

citations.NLM: Efe O, Klein JD, LaRocque LM, Ren H, Sands JM. Metformin improves urine concentration in rodents with nephrogenic diabetes insipidus. JCI Insight. 2016 Jul 21;1(11):. PMID: 27478876

results.title: Physiological insights into novel therapies for nephrogenic diabetes insipidus.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Clopidogrel @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077144 @@@Clopidogrel@@@ is a @GENE_P2RY12 @GENE_64805 @@@P2Y12-R@@@ antagonist that potentiates the effect of @GENE_AVP @GENE_551 @@@vasopressin@@@ and increases @GENE_AQP2 @GENE_359 @@@AQP2@@@ abundance. @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ stimulates @GENE_PRKAA1 @GENE_5562 @@@AMPK@@@ to phosphorylate and activate @GENE_AQP2 @GENE_359 @@@AQP2@@@ and UT-A1, and it increases urine concentrating ability in two @SPECIES_9989 @@@rodent@@@ models of @<m>DISEASE_Diabetes_Insipidus_Nephrogenic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018500 @@@NDI@@@.

citations.NLM: Sands JM, Klein JD. Physiological insights into novel therapies for nephrogenic diabetes insipidus. Am J Physiol Renal Physiol. 2016 Dec 1;311(6):F1149-F1152. PMID: 27534996
citations.BibTeX: @article{27534996, title={Physiological insights into novel therapies for nephrogenic diabetes insipidus.}, author={Sands JM and Klein JD}, journal={Am J Physiol Renal Physiol}, volume={311}, number={6}, pages={F1149-F1152}}

results.title: Metformin, an AMPK activator, stimulates the phosphorylation of aquaporin 2 and urea transporter A1 in inner medullary collecting ducts.
results.text_hl: These findings suggest that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ may be a novel therapeutic option for @<m>DISEASE_Diabetes_Insipidus_Nephrogenic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018500 @@@congenital NDI@@@ due to @GENE_AVPR2 @GENE_12000 @@@V2R@@@ mutations.

citations.NLM: Klein JD, Wang Y, Blount MA, Molina PA, LaRocque LM, Ruiz JA, Sands JM. Metformin, an AMPK activator, stimulates the phosphorylation of aquaporin 2 and urea transporter A1 in inner medullary collecting ducts. Am J Physiol Renal Physiol. 2016 May 15;310(10):F1008-12. PMID: 26962099
